snippet: The lack of common ground between left and right on abortion, same-sex marriage and contraception shows just how seriously we take these issues.
abstract: The lack of common ground between left and right on abortion, same-sex marriage and contraception shows just how seriously we take these issues.
lead_paragraph: Before he disappointed his many admirers by declining to seek the Republican nomination, Gov. Mitch Daniels of Indiana told the Weekly Standard's Andrew Ferguson that the gravity of the economic and fiscal challenges facing America's next president might require calling a temporary "truce on the so-called social issues." On culture war controversies like abortion and same-sex marriage, he suggested, "we're going to just have to agree to get along for a little while."

headline.main: The Persistence of the Culture War
